ivardefs.name: bodySite
ivardefs.desc: The anatomical location where this condition manifests itself.

ivardefs.name: code
ivardefs.desc: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis.

ivardefs.name: contact_
ivardefs.desc: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

ivardefs.name: date
ivardefs.desc: The date  (and optionally time) when the condition definition was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the condition

ivardefs.name: definition_
ivardefs.desc: Formal definitions of the condition. These may be references to ontologies, published clinical protocols or research papers.

ivardefs.name: description
ivardefs.desc: A free text natural language description of the condition definition from a consumer's perspective.

ivardefs.name: experimental
ivardefs.desc: A Boolean value to indicate that this condition definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

ivardefs.name: hasBodySite
ivardefs.desc: Whether bodySite is appropriate to collect for this condition.

ivardefs.name: hasSeverity
ivardefs.desc: Whether Severity is appropriate to collect for this condition.

ivardefs.name: hasStage
ivardefs.desc: Whether stage is appropriate to collect for this condition.

ivardefs.name: identifier_
ivardefs.desc: A formal identifier that is used to identify this condition definition when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

ivardefs.name: jurisdiction_
ivardefs.desc: A legal or geographic region in which the condition definition is intended to be used.

ivardefs.name: medication_
ivardefs.desc: Medications particularly relevant for this condition.

ivardefs.name: name
ivardefs.desc: A natural language name identifying the condition definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

ivardefs.name: observation_
ivardefs.desc: Observations particularly relevant to this condition.

ivardefs.name: plan_
ivardefs.desc: Plan that is appropriate.

ivardefs.name: precondition_
ivardefs.desc: An observation that suggests that this condition applies.

ivardefs.name: publisher
ivardefs.desc: The name of the organization or individual that published the condition definition.

ivardefs.name: questionnaire_
ivardefs.desc: Questionnaire for this condition.

ivardefs.name: severity
ivardefs.desc: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

ivardefs.name: stage
ivardefs.desc: Clinical stage or grade of a condition. May include formal severity assessments.

ivardefs.name: status
ivardefs.desc: The status of this condition definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

ivardefs.name: subtitle
ivardefs.desc: An explanatory or alternate title for the event definition giving additional information about its content.

ivardefs.name: team_
ivardefs.desc: Appropriate team for this condition.

ivardefs.name: title
ivardefs.desc: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the condition definition.

ivardefs.name: url
ivardefs.desc: An absolute URI that is used to identify this condition definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at whi

ivardefs.name: useContext_
ivardefs.desc: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist w

ivardefs.name: version
ivardefs.desc: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the condition definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the condition definition author and is not expected to be globally

properties.desc: A definition of a condition and information relevant to managing it.
